intro: Cyathocalyx sumatranus, commonly known as the Sumatran bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are opposite in arrangement, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
